Course Provider : Western Sydney University Campuses :NSW Naturopaths use non-invasive, natural treatments that align with the body's natural healing abilities. They use a variety of treatments, including: A normal day for a naturopath can include any of the following: There are a range of workplaces for naturopaths to pursue their careers, including: You can find naturopathic clinics throughout Australian's cities and towns, and it's likely that you'll start your career at one of them. After getting some experience, you may decide to open your own clinic and be your own boss. Health and wellness clinics have become one of the most popular places for people to relax and unwind, and forget about their daily stresses for a few hours. They usually hire massage therapists, nutritionists, homeopaths, and general naturopaths, providing plenty of job opportunities. Traditional clinical settings such as hospitals are starting to come round to the efficacy of naturopathy, and have started offering complementary therapies such as homeopathy to patients. This provides career opportunities for the budding naturopath. Australia has one main qualification for naturopathy—the Bachelor of Health Science (Naturopathy)—a four year degree that is the primary pathway for becoming a naturopath. To find accredited naturopathy courses in Melbourne, check out our course finder feature above. Course duration: 4 year full time (24 hours per week), or 8 years part time (12 hours per week) Study mode: Mixture of on campus learning, and online learning Years of experience: 7.3% entry level, 36.3% early career, 21% mid career, 26.6 experience, and 8.9% late career Entry requirements: Year 12 or equivalent Units
